puakma.addin.http.action
Class HTTPSessionContext

java.lang.Object
  puakma.addin.http.action.HTTPSessionContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
ErrorDetect
public class HTTPSessionContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements ErrorDetect

This object is passed to the Actions. It contains all the things that an action should need related to an instance of a user's session.

addSessionObject

public boolean addSessionObject(java.lang.String sKey,
                                java.lang.Object obj)
Store an object by name on to the user's session. This object will only remain in memory and can only be accessed by this session. Useful for storing volatile session related info, for example shopping cart info.

Parameters:
sKey - The to refer to and retrieve this object in the future
obj - The object to store
Returns:
true if the object was stored successfully

getSessionObject

public java.lang.Object getSessionObject(java.lang.String sKey)
Get an object stored on a user's session

Parameters:
sKey - the name of the object to retrieve
Returns:
the object, nul if no object of that name had been previously stored

getSessionObjectKeys

public java.util.Vector getSessionObjectKeys()
Get a Vector of object names that have been stored on this session

Returns:
a list of object names

removeSessionObject

public boolean removeSessionObject(java.lang.String sKey)
Remove an object from the session

Parameters:
sKey - the name of the object to remove
Returns:
true if an object was successfully removed

public java.lang.String getFirstName()

Returns:
firstname eg "John"

getLoginTime

public java.util.Date getLoginTime()
Get the time this session logged in

Returns:
the date/time this session logged in to the server

getLoginName

public java.lang.String getLoginName()
Get the login name used to successfully log in. This is not the X500Name, but the short name the user entered, eg "jsmith"

Returns:
the login name eg "jsmith"

isLoggedIn

public boolean isLoggedIn()
Determines if this session is logged in. This is determined by the username not being "Anonymous"

Returns:
true if the user is not anonymous

isSecureConnection

public boolean isSecureConnection()
Determines if this session is secure, network I/O encrypted using SSL

Returns:
true if the connection is using SSL

getLastTransactionTime

public java.util.Date getLastTransactionTime()
Gets the last date/time of a server request. Can be used to determine the idle state of a session.

Returns:
the Date of the last request

getUserAgent

public java.lang.String getUserAgent()
For web clients, this denotes the "User-Agent" http header

Returns:
the String value of the type of client being used to access the server

public java.lang.String getUserName()

Returns:
the X500Name, eg "CN=Brendon Upson/O=webWise"

getDesignObject

public DesignElement getDesignObject(java.lang.String sDesignName,
                                     int iDesignType)
Get the named design element from the current application.

Parameters:
sDesignName - The name of the design element as it appears in the design list eg "HomePage"
iDesignType - Use DesignElement.DESIGN_TYPE_XXXXX eg DesignElement.DESIGN_TYPE_PAGE. the puakma.addin.http.document.DesignElement object for a list of types
Returns:
null if not found

getAllDesignElementNames

Parameters:
iDesignType - Use DesignElement.DESIGN_TYPE_XXXXX eg DesignElement.DESIGN_TYPE_PAGE
Returns:
a String array of all the design element names in this application

                                      throws java.lang.Exception

an - Exception if there was a problem getting the connection

removeAllUserRolesObjects

public void removeAllUserRolesObjects()
Clear all the cached roles from this session. This has almost the same effect as logging a user out. The next time an application is accessed the roles for that application will be reapplied to this session

removeUserRole

public void removeUserRole(java.lang.String sAppPath,
                           java.lang.String sRoleName)

Parameters:
sAppPath - eg "/group/app.pma"
sRoleName - eg "Manager"

getKeywordValue

public java.lang.String getKeywordValue(java.lang.String sKey)
Gets the first keyword matching szKey (case insensitive). Note that if there are multiple keywords, there is no guarantee which will be returned.

Parameters:
sKey -
Returns:
null if no match

Gets all keywords matching sKey (case insensitive).

Parameters:
sKey - the keyword name
bSortByValue - Pass true to have the results put in the vector in sorted Data order.
Returns:
null if no match

streamToClient

public void streamToClient(byte[] buf)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Send a block of bytes directly to the browser. Note the buffer is flushed after each call, so call this method fewer times for better IO performance

Throws:
java.io.IOException
